# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that defines the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= word * " "
    end
    
    result *= "\n" * line # Add the last line
    
    return result
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
print(wrap_string(s))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur adipiscing 
elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et dolore 
magna aliqua.
```
